Directions.1: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir ground beef and onion in the hot skillet until beef is browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain and discard grease.

Directions.2: Reduce the heat to medium and add green pepper, apple cider vinegar, Dijon mustard, garlic, parsley, and salt. Mix well.

Directions.3: Meanwhile, bring 2/3 cup of water to a boil in a small pot and add the dates. Boil just long enough to soften the dates, 30 to 60 seconds. Remove the dates from the pot. Reserve 2 tablespoons of the cooking liquid.

Directions.4: Place the dates into a food processor or blender with tomato sauce and tomato paste; blend well.

Directions.5: Add pureed date mixture plus reserved cooking liquid to the beef.

Directions.6: Prick a potato several times with a fork or knife. Microwave on High power until soft, 5 to 7 minutes. Repeat with remaining potatoes.

Directions.7: Serve Sloppy Joe mixture on top of potatoes.
